name: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2485
Reason: 5-methyl-3-(2,4,6-trimethylphenyl)-1H-pyrazole has a melting point that we can predict by considering its structural components: (1) The basic pyrazole ring has a melting point around 100°C due to its rigidity and potential hydrogen bonding. (2) The methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, raising the melting point by approximately +10°C due to steric hindrance and increasing the molecular volume. (3) The two phenyl groups, when connected to a pyrazole ring, significantly increase the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C.
